intro-birthday.speaker: mother
intro-birthday.text: I know it's your birthday coming up, sweetie, are you super excited?

intro-day-off.speaker: pandora
intro-day-off.text: Of course, mom, did you manage to get the day off from the deli?

intro-extra-gift.speaker: mother
intro-extra-gift.text: No, sweetie, don't worry about me. It just means you'll have an extra awesome gift this year!

scene1-call-4.speaker: mother
scene1-call-4.text: Awesome, is your army training going over well? I felt like it's been forever since you called. Your sister misses her brother very much, I can tell.

scene1-call-6.speaker: mother
scene1-call-6.text: That's a great idea, just let us know when you're back from base.

scene1-call-8.speaker: mother
scene1-call-8.text: Well, what do you... mean? I thought you weren't chosen for that...

scene1-call-9.speaker: mother
scene1-call-9.text: Sweetie, are you sure you want to help? The Great War... it's really horrible right now.

scene1-call-11.speaker: mother
scene1-call-11.text: Okay... yes... I trust you, I do. I just worry, that's all. you know me.

scene1-call-12.speaker: mother
scene1-call-12.text: Stay safe sweetie. I love you. Pandora loves you. Call us when you can.

scene1-pasta-1.speaker: pandora
scene1-pasta-1.text: Is the pasta okay? I tried to make it how you always do for me.

scene1-pasta-2.speaker: mother
scene1-pasta-2.text: Yeah, sweetie... it's just... nothing. I'm not too hungry right now.

scene1-pasta-4.speaker: pandora
scene1-pasta-4.text: I thought your check wasn't going to come for two days? What's that?

scene1-pasta-5.speaker: mother
scene1-pasta-5.text: Oh, no... sweetie, that's just the bills. Boring mom stuff.

scene1-pasta-7.speaker: pandora
scene1-pasta-7.text: No, no, no. I'm fine. We're fine.

scene1-letter-2.speaker: letter
scene1-letter-2.text: I REGRET TO INFORM YOU THAT SOLDIER NO. 87629 DIED IN BATTLE AT APPROXIMATELY 1100 HOURS.

scene1-letter-3.speaker: letter
scene1-letter-3.text: WE THANK HIM FOR HIS SERVICE, AND WE HOPE YOU CAN FIND PEACE IN HIS ABSENCE.

scene1-letter-4.speaker: letter
scene1-letter-4.text: SIGNED, ARMY BASE NO. 43, POLARIS DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE

fridge.speaker: pandora
fridge.text: Hmm... I wonder what kind of breakfast day it is.

portrait.speaker: pandora
portrait.text: To think that was taken 2 years ago. Mom looks so... different?

picture.speaker: pandora
picture.text: This used to be in the living room. I almost forgot what his uniform looked like.

flag.speaker: pandora
flag.text: ...is that what my brother fought for?

must-check-in-mom.speaker: mother
must-check-in-mom.text: I think I should check in with Mother before I leave...

scene1-mother-1.speaker: pandora
scene1-mother-1.text: Hi mom, are you okay today? Is it getting any better?

scene1-mother-3.speaker: pandora
scene1-mother-3.text: Have you been trying those breathing exercises we learned a few weeks ago? They said it really helps.

scene1-mother-9.speaker: pandora
scene1-mother-9.text: Well, in case you forgot, you still have another child. If you need me, I'll be at the deli.

mother-bookshelf-1.speaker: pandora
mother-bookshelf-1.text: I remembered when she'd be so excited to read me bedtime stories.

mother-bed.speaker: pandora
mother-bed.text: I hope she's been sleeping okay. Not that she's been working anyway...

mother-picture.speaker: pandora
mother-picture.text: This used to be in the living room. I almost forgot what his uniform looked like.

scene1-outside-home.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-home.text: I need to get to work at the deli. How else will we survive?

scene1-outside-home-window.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-home-window.text: Hopefully she won't miss me too much...

scene1-outside-home-window-2.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-home-window-2.text: Deep down, she probably won't anyway.

scene1-outside-banner.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-banner.text: 'THE GREAT WAR DEATH TOLL RISES TO 500,000'... what? Already? Why can't Polaris just call it quits?

scene1-outside-bank.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-bank.text: I just hope we never need to exhaust our savings. The deli is probably wondering where I am...

scene1-outside-fast-food-door.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-fast-food-door.text: If only I had time to stop for a bite. Mom used to love this place so much.

scene1-outside-homeless-guy.speaker: jenkins
scene1-outside-homeless-guy.text: Hey, can ya spare any change? Please, anything...

scene1-outside-homeless-guy-gift.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-homeless-guy-gift.text: It's your lucky day, sir. Is this enough for breakfast?

scene1-outside-homeless-guy-gift2.speaker: jenkins
scene1-outside-homeless-guy-gift2.text: Gee, thank ya. It'll be money well spent.

scene1-outside-homeless-guy-deny.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-homeless-guy-deny.text: I'm sorry sir. Not today, maybe tomorrow, though?

scene1-outside-businessman.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-businessman.text: Out of the way please, got places to be! Places to be!

scene1-outside-businessman2.speaker: richard
scene1-outside-businessman2.text: Wow, some people are just always in a rush.

scene1-outside-clock.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-clock.text: Phew, just on time. Mom would be proud. A quick 12-hour shift, and I'll be done in no time.

scene1-outside-closed-sign.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-closed-sign.text: I can't forget to flip that once I open up. The last two times, I've forgotten.

scene1-outside-closed-sign2.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-closed-sign2.text: ... I guess there's just been a lot on my mind.

scene1-outside-dumpster.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-dumpster.text: That's my least favorite part of the job. Though, someone has to do it. I'm sure Ryan appreciates it.

scene1-outside-sydney.speaker: sydney
scene1-outside-sydney.text: Don't you worry, honey, it's just sandwiches after all!

scene1-outside-james.speaker: james
scene1-outside-james.text: I've been waiting here for MANY minutes. What's the hold up?

scene1-outside-james2.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-james2.text: Sir, we are just about to open.

scene1-outside-julie.speaker: julie
scene1-outside-julie.text: Um... excuse me... when do you open?

scene1-outside-julie2.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-julie2.text: Hi little lady! We're opening any minute now.

scene1-outside-julie3.speaker: james
scene1-outside-julie3.text: Why are you talking to my kid? Just do your job, okay?

scene1-ryan.speaker: ryan
scene1-ryan.text: Something on your mind kiddo? I know that was quite a shift.

scene1-ryan2.speaker: pandora
scene1-ryan2.text: No, well... work was fine. It's... it's just my mom. She's been acting...

scene1-ryan5.speaker: pandora
scene1-ryan5.text: It's as if she has no life anymore. Her trauma has taken over everything...

scene1-ryan7.speaker: pandora
scene1-ryan7.text: She-she doesn't even respond to me anymore. What should I do??

scene1-ryan8.speaker: ryan
scene1-ryan8.text: Jeez, kiddo. I had no idea.

scene1-ryan9.speaker: ryan
scene1-ryan9.text: I'll tell ya what, take the next few days off, okay? When I was going through a rough time, some pills never hurt anyone.

scene1-ryan11.speaker: pandora
scene1-ryan11.text: No... I haven't. Is that what she needs right now?

scene1-ryan12.speaker: ryan
scene1-ryan12.text: Kiddo, I'm sure it's better than nothing.

scene1-ryan13.speaker: pandora
scene1-ryan13.text: Maybe you're right. Thanks, Ryan. I guess I'll head to the pharmacy tonight.

scene1-construction.speaker: pandora
scene1-construction.text: Great, guess I'll have to find another way home after the pharmacy.

scene1-outside-train-banner.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-train-banner.text: 'QUIK INC. UP 12% FOLLOWING DEBUT OF NEW TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE'... pftt, wish we could get some of that.

scene1-outside-ticket-booth.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-ticket-booth.text: Maybe it'd be easier to just escape this place...

scene1-outside-mothers-day.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-mothers-day.text: 'CELEBRATE MOMS EVERYWHERE, COME ON DOWN TO HOMEIFY FOR 50% OFF ON MOTHER'S DAY'... how could I forget? Was that today?

scene1-outside-mothers-day2.speaker: pandora
scene1-outside-mothers-day2.text: More the reason to help mom out with these pills.

scene1-cave-intro.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-intro.text: Where... where am I? Is this a cave?

scene1-cave-hole.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-hole.text: I'll need to find a way back up eventually...

scene1-cave-stone.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-stone.text: I... I see my mother. She's...

scene1-cave-stone2.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-stone2.text: Happy? What, what is this? And... I see Ryan's Deli. She's there and working like it was before.

scene1-cave-stone3.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-stone3.text: This could be the cure... after all this time. I=I'll have my mother back.

scene1-cave-pickup.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-pickup.text: Wow, it's much heavier than I thought.

scene1-cave-pickup2.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-pickup2.text: I feel... relieved. I can't even remember what I was worrying about.

scene1-cave-pickup3.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-pickup3.text: Oh, right, my mom. Maybe she'll feel the same from this stone, too.

scene1-cave-other-stones.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-other-stones.text: Those must be more of the stones! I'll have to come back another time for them.

scene1-cave-vine.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-vine.text: Maybe I could use this to get out of here?

scene1-cave-vine2.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-vine2.text: To think that my mom might be healing by the morning... I've missed her smile, her laugh...

scene1-cave-vine3.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-vine3.text: ... her love for me. her life is no way to live right now, that's for sure.

scene1-cave-vine4.speaker: pandora
scene1-cave-vine4.text: Thank goodness I found that vine, though. I can finally get back home.

scene1-home.speaker: pandora
scene1-home.text: Mom I-I think I found something to help you.

scene1-home3.speaker: pandora
scene1-home3.text: I found this odd stone on the way back home from the deli today. It made me feel... better.

scene1-home5.speaker: pandora
scene1-home5.text: Please take it... I know how crazy this sounds. Trust me, I know I sound crazy. I just...

scene1-home6.speaker: pandora
scene1-home6.text: ... care so much. I want you to be happy and yourself again.

scene1-home7.speaker: mother
scene1-home7.text: There's nothing to do, just get to bed.

scene1-bed.speaker: pandora
scene1-bed.text: I just want your pain to go away. Is that too much to ask for? I'm leaving the stone here.

scene1-bed2.speaker: pandora
scene1-bed2.text: Just don't skip breakfast tomorrow. You have to eat, mom. You have to.

dont-jump.speaker: pandora
dont-jump.text: That's not a way to go out...
